senses.de: The same in all cases and at all times; not changing or varying
senses.ex: School uniform is the same for everyone.

Tips.title: Metaphorical Use
Tips.description: 'Uniform' describes consistency, often in abstract situations beyond clothing.
Tips.example: Expectations were uniform across the board.

Tips.title: No Variation
Tips.description: 'Uniform' emphasizes lack of diversity or deviation in elements of a group.
Tips.example: The rows of corn were planted in uniform lines.

Tips.title: Uniform vs. Unique
Tips.description: 'Uniform' is the opposite of 'unique'; it implies sameness, not originality or distinctiveness.

senses.de: A special set of clothes that people wear to do a particular job or to go to a particular school
senses.ex: Every student must wear a uniform to school.

Tips.title: Identity Marker
Tips.description: Uniforms can symbolize membership in a group, profession, or institution.
Tips.example: She donned her nurse's uniform with pride.

Tips.title: Formal Requirement
Tips.description: 'Uniform' indicates a mandatory dress code, often for work or school.
Tips.example: The company's uniform included a blazer with the logo.

Tips.title: Cultural Significance
Tips.description: The style of uniforms can carry cultural weight and historical significance.
Tips.example: The guards wore a uniform styled after 19th-century soldiers.

senses.de: To make things the same or similar
senses.ex: The procedure is designed to uniform the data.

Tips.title: Consistency in Processes
Tips.description: 'Uniform' as a verb relates to creating standardization in methods or procedures.
Tips.example: The team worked to uniform their testing protocols.

Tips.title: Focus on Similarity
Tips.description: Using 'uniform' as a verb focuses on making dissimilar things alike in form or character.
Tips.example: The software is updated to uniform file format support.

Conform.wordDefinition:
Conform refers to the act of following rules or guidelines to fit with a certain standard or expectation. It is applicable in situations where you have to adjust your behavior or actions to meet the requirements of a particular group or society.

For example, if a school has a dress code, the students are expected to conform to the dress code by wearing appropriate clothing.

Conform means to adjust your behavior to fit a standard, while uniform means clothing that is identical or similar in style.

Consistent.wordDefinition:
Consistent means something that is always the same or is reliable throughout. This can refer to a person's behavior or a process that always produces the same result.

For example, if someone consistently arrives at work on time, it means that they always arrive on time and can be relied upon to do so.

It can refer to clothing or appearance, but can also refer to standards or regulations that are consistent across different areas.

Consistent refers to something that is reliable and unchanging, while uniform refers to something that is the same throughout in terms of appearance or standards.

Homogeneous.wordDefinition:
The words homogeneous and uniform both mean "the same throughout," but they are used in slightly different ways.

Homogeneous describes a substance that has the same composition throughout, like a mixture that is well mixed.

For example, a glass of pure water is homogeneous because it has the same molecules throughout, while a glass of water with sugar dissolved in it is still uniform (the sugar is evenly distributed) but not homogeneous (the sugar molecules are separate from the water molecules).

Homogeneous is used more often in chemistry or physics, while uniform is used more in everyday life to describe things like clothing, patterns, or colors.

Identical.wordDefinition:
Identical means that two things are exactly the same in every way, while the word uniform means that two things have the same appearance or style, but may not be exactly the same.

For example, identical twins have the same DNA and physical traits, while students in a school may wear a uniform that looks the same, but their personalities and abilities may be different.

Identical is used when things are exactly the same, while uniform is used when things have a similar appearance or style.

Regular.wordDefinition:
Regular means something that occurs commonly or on a normal basis.

It describes something that happens in a predictable and consistent manner. For example, if you go to school every day, that is a regular routine.

Regular describes the frequency or pattern of something, while uniform describes the appearance or structure of something.

Same.wordDefinition:
Same means identical or alike in every way. For example, if you and your friend have the same shirt, it means that the shirt you both have is the identical shirt in every way.

Uniform means consistent or standardized in appearance, design or behavior. For example, if all students in a school wear the same type of clothing, it means that everyone is wearing a uniform that is consistent in appearance.

The key difference between the two words is that same refers to identical things, while uniform refers to things that are consistent or standardized in appearance, design or behavior.

Every time you are referring to things that are alike, without having differences, you use same.

If you are referring to things that are consistent, standardized or have the same appearance or design, you use uniform.

Standardize.wordDefinition:
Standardize means to establish a standard or a set of rules that must be followed in order to maintain consistency and quality.

Standardize is used to establish rules and guidelines for consistency and quality, while uniform refers to something that is identical and consistent throughout.

Unvarying.wordDefinition:
Unvarying refers to something that does not change or vary. For example, the rising and setting of the sun is an unvarying event.

Uniform applies to things that have a consistent appearance or behavior, while unvarying applies to things that are constant and do not change.

I mean, if you're like me, math and logic is not easy. We don't get it all right, but at least the selection pressures are not uniformly away from true math and logic.

quotes.Text: So long as I'm Commander-in-Chief, we will sustain the strongest military the world has ever known. When you take off the uniform, we will serve you as well as you've served us - because no one who fights for this country should have to fight for a job, or a roof over their head, or the care that they need when they come home.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Barack Obama

quotes.Text: This is something I've wanted to do my whole life is play baseball, and I think just the opportunity to put on a big-league uniform every day is just... you know, people dream of it, but not everybody gets to do it. I'm thankful every day I get to do it.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Jacob deGrom

quotes.Text: When my dad first started out in the police force, wearing the uniform was a sense of pride, and it was respected in the community for what the police force was all about. Unfortunately today, the uniform is a target.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Jerry Doyle

quotes.Text: I don't have a set way of dressing or a uniform, though I kind of wish I did. But then again, I also love that I can be any sort of character I want - that's a little bit of the actress coming out of me.
quotes.Title: English Model
quotes.Name: Poppy Delevingne

quotes.Text: My experience in uniform has shaped my life and informed who I am like no other, and it's difficult for me to wrap my mind around the idea that I will no longer be a soldier.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Jason Kander

quotes.Text: To all general purposes we have uniformly been one people, each individual citizen everywhere enjoying the same national rights, privileges, and protection.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Alexander Hamilton

quotes.Text: The soldiers who serve in uniform at the front are our real heroes. They fight a battle every day to protect the integrity of the nation.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Nana Patekar

quotes.Text: People test movies within an inch of their life so that the entire audience experience is a uniform one.
quotes.Title: British Writer
quotes.Name: Peter Morgan

quotes.Text: I see the world become so uniform. Everybody has to be the same. I like people who are different.
quotes.Title: French Actor
quotes.Name: Eric Cantona

quotes.Text: I could never wear another uniform. I will forever be a Yankee.
quotes.Title: Puerto Rican Athlete
quotes.Name: Jorge Posada
